src.NodeModule package

Module contents

class src.NodeModule.Node(port, connection, gui)[source]

Bases: object

Node class stores the attributes required for the p2p network and blockchain

Variables:

  • gui (Gui) – Gui object for exit

  • port (int) – port that node is connected to

  • sock (socket) – port socket

  • peers (list of int) – list of peers

  • network_messages (list of str) – list of messages in system

  • peer_ports (list of int) – list of peer ports

  • peer_dict (dict) – dictionary connecting peer:port

  • balance (int) – acount balance

  • unspent (list of Transaction) – unspent transactions in the system

  • my_unspent (list of transactions) – my unspent transactions

  • last_transaction (str) – last transaction sent in system

  • event_messages (str) – message to be shown on gui.home

  • transaction_pool (Transaction) – transaction pool of node

  • private_key (Key) – private key of user

  • public_key (Key) – public key of the user

  • pub_key_str (str) – string representation of the public key

  • blockchain (Blockchain) – Blockchain object, personal copy of the blockchain

  • eligible (bool) – bool if the block is eligible to send transactions

  • mining (bool) – bool toggle mining on/off

  • block_found (str) – bool whether a new block has been found or not

addr_to_pub(addr)[source]

Turns the address back into the public key

Parameters:

addr (str) – public key secure

Returns:

pub_key_str

Return type:

str

check_addr(addr)[source]

Checks the address checksum is correct for the rest of the address

Parameters:

addr (str) – address

Returns:

the address is valid

Return type:

bool

connect_to_peer(peer_port)[source]

Connect to a peer via a port number

Parameters:

peer_port (int) – port to connect to

gen_coins()[source]

Generates 100 coins for the user

generate_keys()[source]

Generates the keys for the node

handler(c, a)[source]

Handles all of the messages in the system

TRANSACTION - For recieving new transactions BLOCK- For recieving new blocks CHAIN - For recieving a chain PORT - For connecting to the new port number EXIT - For checking which socket has left the system

Parameters:

  • c (socket) – new socket object

  • a (list) – remote address

listen()[source]

Listens for connections and creates new thread for each connection

miner()[source]

Mining tries to create a new block when the new round begins. It attempts to beet the other nodes in creating a valid block. If it wins it will add the block to their personal chain and then send it across the p2p network

pub_to_addr(key)[source]

Turns the public key into a secure public key/address

Parameters:

key (str) – pub_key_str

Returns:

public key secure

Return type:

str

regenerate_keys()[source]

Regenerates new keys and sends the nodes unspent transactions to the new key

send_message(message)[source]

Sends a message to all peers and removes broken connections

Parameters:

message (str) – message to send

sock = <socket.socket fd=6, family=AddressFamily.AF_INET, type=SocketKind.SOCK_STREAM, proto=0, laddr=('0.0.0.0', 0)>
transaction_maker(transaction_to_spend, script_pub_key, value, transaction_fee, to_spend_value)[source]

Creates a transaction, the change transaction and the fee transaction

Parameters:

  • transaction_to_spend (list of Transaction or Transaction) – the selected transaction(s) to send

  • script_pub_key (str) – script_pub_key of the transactions

  • value (int) – value of the new main transaction

  • transaction_fee (int) – the value of the transaction fee

  • to_spend_value (int) – sum of the values of the transactions in transaction_to_spend

Returns:

transaction creation succesful

Return type:

bool

unspent_to_txt()[source]

Creates a .txt file that outputs the unspent transactions

utxo()[source]

Updates the balance, unspent and my unspent by checking the transactions in the blockchain and transaction pool.
